properties.question: What is the most immediate imaging modality used to diagnose septic arthritis in children and adults?
properties.option_a: X-ray, as it can quickly show joint space narrowing and bone changes.
properties.option_b: MRI, due to its superior soft tissue contrast and ability to detect early joint inflammation.
properties.option_c: CT scan, because it provides detailed images of bone structures and can identify subtle fractures.
properties.option_d: Ultrasound, for its real-time imaging and ability to detect joint effusions.
